title: Versa Concerto SD-WAN Authentication Bypass - Active Exploitation (CISA KEV)

timeline.event: CISA adds CVE-2025-34026 to KEV catalog

simple_summary.what_happened: Versa Concerto SD-WAN orchestration platform contains an authentication bypass vulnerability in its Traefik reverse proxy configuration. Attackers can access administrative endpoints without authentication and retrieve sensitive data including heap dumps and trace logs containing credentials.
simple_summary.who_is_affected: Organizations using Versa Concerto for SD-WAN management and orchestration across distributed enterprise networks.
simple_summary.what_attackers_do: Step 1: Identify exposed Versa Concerto deployments on the internet. Step 2: Exploit Traefik reverse proxy misconfiguration to bypass authentication. Step 3: Access internal Actuator endpoints without credentials. Step 4: Retrieve heap dumps containing passwords, API keys, and secrets. Step 5: Pivot to SD-WAN infrastructure for full network control.
what_you_should_do: Restrict access to Concerto management interface to internal networks only
Rotate all credentials that may have been exposed in heap dumps
Review access logs for unauthorized activity
Implement network segmentation for management plane
simple_summary.why_this_is_serious: SD-WAN orchestration platforms control network connectivity across distributed enterprise sites. Compromise enables network manipulation, traffic interception, man-in-the-middle attacks, and lateral movement to branch offices and cloud environments.

tactics.description: Pivot to SD-WAN managed network infrastructure

detection_guidance.summary: Monitor access to Concerto management interface for unauthorized requests to /actuator endpoints. Watch for unusual API calls and credential usage patterns.

immediate_actions.description: Block public access to Concerto interface
Change all passwords that may have been in heap dumps
Check for /actuator endpoint access in past 30 days
